summary: Internal FBI email chain discussing logistical planning for a search warrant execution on Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas. The email coordinates availability for FBI analysts and outlines tentative travel plans for the search operation.

persons.name: SSA FBI New York
persons.context: Author of email coordinating the search warrant planning for Epstein's island, leading Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking.

events.title: Search Warrant Sworn Out
events.description: Expected date for the search warrant affidavit for Epstein's island to be sworn out in St. Thomas.

events.title: FBI Team Travel to St. Thomas
events.description: Planned travel date for FBI team to fly to St. Thomas on an FBI Q400 plane to execute the search warrant.

events.title: Search of Epstein's Island
events.description: Expected 1-3 day search operation of Epstein's private island off St. Thomas, managed by the FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT).

events.title: FBI Team Return Travel
events.description: Planned travel day for FBI team to return home from St. Thomas after completing the search.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively planning a search of Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas in August 2019.
The search warrant affidavit was being drafted by SDNY and expected to be sworn out on Friday, August 9, 2019.
The FBI planned to fly a team to St. Thomas on Sunday, August 11, 2019, using an FBI Q400 plane.
The search operation was expected to take 1-3 days and be managed by the FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT).
The email indicates coordination within FBI New York's Squad C-20, which handles Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking cases.
